sub_title: Regulatory Affairs Director Image Guided Therapy EPD Solutions at Philips
summary:
In the future, medical technology will focus on combining medical devices for diagnosis, treatment and/or therapy into one medical solutions.  

I am a member of the EPD Solutions Management Team and leading the regulatory affairs group within the IGT EPD Solutions.

I started my career as a Senior Biomedical Equipment engineer in a hospital. I also worked as an independent advisor for Quality Management Systems and as a Consultant in Medical Devices regulation and standardization. 

I was employed by the Amsterdam University Hospital in the position of quality control engineer for physics and medical technology.

As a Principal Consultant Medical Devices I had experience in conducting technical writing and editing of medical electrical equipment compliance documents for basic safety and essential performance as well as Quality Management System implementation and compliance. 

As a Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager for Philips Image Guided Therapy - Business Incubation (Philips IGT-BI), I work together with R&D development core teams (of different alliance company ventures) on the preparation of new market authorization for innovative medical device combinations.

Specialized in electrical medical devices and medical software, I am particularly interested in medical device risk management and technical documentation required for regulatory clearance. I hold a bachelor degree in polytechnics, and I am an expert in biomedical engineering.

projects.title: AltaTrack system FDA Clearance
projects.description: I am responsible as a regulatory affairs manager for the FDA clearance of AltaTrack system in 2020 (510(k) Premarket Notification see project link below). The AltaTrack system is an imaging device with Fiber Optic RealShape (FORS) technology intended to aid the positioning and navigation of a connected AltaTrack Catheter and/or AltaTrack Guidewire during endovascular procedures of the peripheral, aortic and aortic side branch vasculature, by creating a 3D image in real time of an AltaTrack Catheter and/or AltaTrack Guidewire. This unique technology enables real-time 3D visualization of the full shape of devices inside the body without the need for fluoroscopy.

projects.title: Stimuplex Onvision System FDA Clearance
projects.description: I am responsible as a regulatory affairs manager for the FDA clearance of Stimuplex Onvision System in 2020 (510(k) Premarket Notification see project link below).  Stimuplex Onvision System represents an ultrasound guidance solution for real-time needle tip tracking. The solution is a combination of the Philips Xperius ultrasound system and Onvision system together with the dedicated Stimuplex Onvision needle. This has been achieved in a multi-year strategic alliance project between Philips and B. Braun to innovate in ultrasound-guided regional anesthesia.

profile_positions.description:
As a Principal Consultant I advise Healthcare companies about medical device submissions and quality management systems in: 
•	Europe (MDD 93/42/EEC, AIMD and ISO 13485), 
•	US (510(k) and QRS + FDA guidance), 
•	Canada (SOR/98-282), 
•	Australia (Therapeutic Goods Act and ARGMD) 

Related subjects, such as: 
•	Radio and Telecommunication Terminal Equipment (R&TTE), 
•	Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC), 
•	Machinery, 
•	Optical Radiation, 
•	Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) and 
•	Protection of personal data.

With a background as a Biomedical Engineer, I write compliance documents and I am also a Trainer and Auditor for Medical Device Regulations and related subjects: 
•	Basic safety and essential performance (IEC 60601-1), 
•	Medical Software (IEC 62304), 
•	Risk Management (ISO 14971), 
•	Usability (IEC 62366), 
•	Biological Evaluation (ISO 10993), 
•	Clinical Evaluation (ISO 14155), 
•	Labelling (several standards), 
for Design files (STED and 510(k)).
profile_positions.title: Business Area Manager Regulatory Compliance – Active Devices and Software (Principal Consultant)

profile_positions.description:
As a quality control engineer I was responsible for establishing a QMS for all the Medical Electrical Equipment in the VU UMC as a project. During this project, I established an overall policy and a Quality Management System of Medical Electrical Equipment with focus on Safety and performance, Purchase, Design and Development, Modification, Introduction, Use, Calibration, Inspection, Maintenance, Repair and Disposal.

During my project for the VU UMC, I also held a lecture at the University on the Design and Development of the Da Vinci Robotic Surgical System and was a key speaker at  congresses concerning quality and risk management with regard to the development, use and maintenance of medical technology.
profile_positions.title: Quality control engineer

profile_positions.description:
As a freelance consultant I advised several hospitals about overall policies and a Quality Management System of Medical Electrical Equipment, together with several Associations, see chapter Organizations Advysica and Kema Quality. 

In 2005, I started to advise manufacturers about the QMS and EU regulations of medical devices and established my first QMS ISO 13485 and STED regarding the design and development for a medical software device, such as an Electroencephalograph stand alone and network system.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
For many years, I worked as a Senior Biomedical Engineer at the Haga Hospital (The Hague, The Netherlands). I was involved in several projects: 
1.	Research and development of measuring the brain symmetry index during a carotid artery operation with Electroencephalograph system. 

2.	Research and development of measuring emboli detection with Transcranial Doppler (TCD) systems. 

3.	Support of Active medical devices such as; electroencephalograph stand alone and network system, electromyography, evoked potential recording system, MRI, CT and IVD equipment regarding: 
a.	Purchase, 
b.	Introduction, 
c.	Electrical patient safety validations, 
d.	Preventive and corrective maintenance, 
e.	Modification. 

4.	Design and Development of electronic and software systems: 
a.	for the measuring of electrical safety according to the IEC 60601-1 standard, 
b.	a database system to control the individual radiation of hospital employees, 
c.	the measuring and control of the temperature of crystal of the gamma camera. 

In cooperation with KEMA Quality and several other hospitals I worked on  a QMS for Medical Electrical Systems according to the Dutch regulations in 1994. In the same period,  the “Besluit Medische hulpmiddelen” came into force as the national implementation of the EU medical device directive and in 1996, the Dutch Quality Law came into force for hospitals and institutions which deliver hospital care.
